title: 107_hr851
content: Conditions on loan guarantees issued to steel companies. Conditions on loan guarantees issued to steel companies are amended to prohibit certain activities. A qualified steel company receiving a loan guarantee cannot use the proceeds to support facilities outside the US or import specific products. Loan guarantees issued to steel companies are amended to prohibit importing ingots, slabs, or billets from countries subject to trade remedies. Violations will result in termination of the guarantee and a civil penalty of up to $100,000 per violation. Penalties can only be imposed after a hearing in accordance with specific regulations. The amendment prohibits importing certain steel products from countries subject to trade remedies under specific conditions. The amendment prohibits importing certain steel products from countries under trade remedies, including investigations or determinations under specific titles of the Tariff Act of 1930 and actions taken by the President under the Trade Act of 1974. The amendment restricts importing specific steel products from countries under trade remedies, including investigations or determinations under certain titles of the Tariff Act of 1930 and actions by the President under the Trade Act of 1974. The amendment restricts importing specific steel products from countries under trade remedies, including investigations or determinations under certain titles of the Tariff Act of 1930 and actions by the President under the Trade Act of 1974, based on determinations of substantial injury by the International Trade Commission. The North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act applies to products from a country under trade remedies or pending proceedings under certain trade acts. The North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act applies to products from a country under trade remedies or pending proceedings under certain trade acts. The term 'United States' includes any commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States. The amendment made by section 1 of the Act applies to loan guarantees issued on or after the enactment date, and to any loan guarantees issued before that date but only to the extent of remaining loan proceeds.
